MSI X is a new packaging format that Microsoft put together a few years ago
it is open source it is developed on github by the windows team and it has a
number of benefits including doing things like keeping all your
applications together so they can be uninstalled cleanly so when you install an MSI X package it puts it all into a
container of sorts windows actually has four different kinds of containers that
running on it this is a one of the container types or it virtualizes access
to certain things so if your application needs to write to the registry or write to certain areas of the filesystem it
can continue to do that but it's going to be redirected to an area within the install directory of the application so
that if it gets uninstalled it's completely clean how many folks here have installed iTunes on Windows ok how
many folks have tried to uninstall iTunes on Windows yeah it's gonna ask you do you succeed so iTunes is actually
in the Windows Store Microsoft Store adds an MSI X package and that is the only way I have it installed because I
know at that point it can be uninstalled cleanly so is a definitely there's a lot
of advantages also for from a practical level it does things like block level Delta updates so if you are working with
areas with poor internet connectivity or where you're measured by the by a tour by that you know just satellite offices
and you need to get an update to your hundred mega application out if you haven't changed the framework it's just
some application the Delta between them is probably pretty small you don't have to think about this you publish the
update and the update mechanisms the tooling does this for you and calculates the differences and only transfers
what's needed windows also has built-in tooling for doing the automatic updates so you don't have to write that or
handle it yourself and you have a lot of control over that so MSI X can be used
to deploy any Windows application it is not tied to you WP it can be used for
MFC applications console apps net framework that's something you can use today even
